name: CBD+ Tranquil Relax
description: A premium blend featuring Ashwagandha, Chamomile, and Lavender for profound anxiety relief and stress reduction. This blend combines the stress-modulating properties of Ashwagandha with the calming effects of Chamomile and Lavender's anxiolytic benefits.
benefits: Ashwagandha reduces stress and anxiety with large effect sizes (SMD -1.75 for stress, -1.55 for anxiety) in meta-analyses of RCTs
Chamomile provides anxiolytic effects through GABA pathway modulation, effective for generalized anxiety disorder
Lavender inhalation significantly reduces anxiety across eleven trials, modulating limbic system activity
Combined effects support HPA axis regulation and neurotransmitter balance
usage: Start at 160-177°C (320-350°F) for flavor preservation and gradually increase to 177-204°C (350-400°F) for balanced extraction. Avoid temperatures above 221°C (430°F). Session length: 5-10 minutes for anxiety relief.
safety: Ashwagandha: Use with caution in thyroid disease; avoid during pregnancy. Chamomile: Potential allergies in Asteraceae-sensitive individuals; may interact with sedatives. Lavender: Generally safe; may cause mild sedation. Not for use during pregnancy or nursing.

name: Herbal Harmony
description: A sophisticated mood-supporting blend that combines Damiana, Rose, Chamomile, and Turmeric to promote emotional balance and well-being. Designed for evening reflection and mood enhancement.
benefits: Damiana provides sweet-herbal aromatics traditionally used for mood support and relaxation
Rose offers gentle mood-lifting properties with floral aromatic benefits
Chamomile supports anxiety reduction and overall emotional well-being
Turmeric (curcumin) shows promising effects in depression and anxiety through anti-inflammatory pathways
usage: Begin at 160°C (320°F) and increase gradually to 190°C (374°F) to discover preferred intensity. Rose aromatics are best preserved at lower temperatures. Session length: 5-15 minutes.
safety: Damiana: Generally safe in moderate amounts. Rose: No significant contraindications. Chamomile: Caution with Asteraceae allergies. Turmeric: Watch for GI effects at high doses. Not evaluated by FDA.

name: Focus Flow
description: A clarifying blend featuring Rosemary, Peppermint, and Ginger to enhance focus, attention, and cognitive performance. Pine-rosemary aroma with cooling mint undertones.
benefits: Rosemary aroma correlates with cognitive performance; 1,8-cineole levels linked to improved attention and memory
Peppermint essential oil shows promise for alertness and processing speed in controlled studies
Ginger improves attention and memory in middle-aged women (RCT evidence at 400-800mg/day oral)
Combined volatile fractions support cognitive enhancement without stimulants
usage: Start at 125-150°C (257-302°F) for optimal volatile release. Rosemary and peppermint benefit from moderate heat. Avoid temperatures above 176°C to prevent bitterness. Session: 5-10 minutes for focus.
safety: Rosemary: Safe in aromatherapy amounts; avoid during pregnancy. Peppermint: Generally safe; may interact with certain medications. Ginger: Well-tolerated; caution with blood thinners. Not for minors.

name: Midnight Calm
description: A soothing bedtime blend combining Chamomile and Lavender with a Mullein base for gentle vapor and honeyed floral aroma. Perfect for evening wind-down rituals.
benefits: Chamomile improves sleep quality and reduces insomnia through GABA modulation
Lavender inhalation reduces stress and promotes relaxation via limbic system pathways
Mullein provides smooth, neutral base for comfortable vapor production
Combined effects support natural sleep onset without pharmaceutical sedation
usage: Start at low temperatures (150-177°C / 302-350°F) to emphasize floral aromatics. Gradually increase to 190-204°C (374-400°F) for fuller extraction. Longer sessions (10-15 minutes) work well for bedtime.
safety: Chamomile: Generally safe; Asteraceae allergy caution. Lavender: Safe for most; mild sedation possible. Mullein: Well-tolerated respiratory herb. May enhance sedative effects of other sleep aids. Not for pregnancy/nursing.

name: Zen Garden
description: A gentle calming blend featuring Lemon Balm and Chamomile for anxiety relief with citrus-herbal notes. Value-priced for daily stress management.
benefits: Lemon Balm shows anxiolytic effects in clinical studies, particularly effective for stress-related symptoms
Chamomile reduces anxiety across multiple populations (GAD, insomnia, menstrual-related anxiety)
Combined formula provides gentle reassurance and calming without sedation
Citrus-herbal profile makes it pleasant for daytime use
usage: Low to medium temperatures (160-190°C / 320-374°F) emphasize flavor without harshness. Start low and adjust to taste. Session: 5-10 minutes as needed for anxiety relief.
safety: Lemon Balm: Generally safe; may cause mild drowsiness. Chamomile: Caution with Asteraceae family allergies; may interact with sedatives. Avoid during pregnancy. Age 21+ only.

name: Luna Mist
description: A bedtime blend featuring Passionflower, Hops, and Chamomile for sleep support with honeyed floral aromatics. Hospital data suggests fixed herbal combinations reduce benzodiazepine use.
benefits: Passionflower in fixed combinations shows signals for anxiety and sleep improvement
Hops contributes to sedative effects and sleep quality enhancement
Chamomile provides anxiolytic and sleep-promoting effects
Real-world data shows reduced benzodiazepine co-prescription with such combinations
usage: A longer, low-heat session (150-177°C / 302-350°F) works well for evening wind-down. Gradually increase to 190-204°C (374-400°F) as desired. Session: 10-15 minutes before bed.
safety: Passionflower: Monitor sedation; may interact with CNS depressants. Hops: Generally safe; sedative effects. Chamomile: Safe for most; allergy caution. Avoid combining with alcohol or sedative medications.

name: Mental Clarity
description: A crisp, refreshing blend of Peppermint and Rosemary for mental clarity and focus. Cool mint with pine-rosemary aromatics for cognitive enhancement.
benefits: Peppermint aroma and essential oil show pre-clinical cognitive benefits and human alertness signals
Rosemary systemic 1,8-cineole levels correlate with cognitive performance in controlled studies
Combined monoterpenes support attention, memory, and processing speed
Straightforward clarity-focused profile without medical claims
usage: Use lower temperatures (125-150°C / 257-302°F) to accentuate mint freshness. Raise to 160-176°C (320-350°F) for fuller body. Session: 5-10 minutes for focus periods.
safety: Peppermint: Generally safe; may interact with certain medications. Rosemary: Safe in aromatherapy; avoid during pregnancy. Both well-tolerated at vaporization temperatures. Not for minors.

name: Sunrise Energy
description: An energizing stress relief blend featuring Ginger, Peppermint, and Tulsi (Holy Basil). Combines stress reduction with gentle vitality for daytime use.
benefits: Ginger supports cognitive processing and attention in RCT evidence
Peppermint provides alertness and cooling sensory effects
Tulsi (Holy Basil) reduces stress and stress biomarkers in 8-week RCT at 125mg twice daily
Combined profile supports stress resilience while maintaining clarity
usage: Start at 130-150°C (266-302°F) for optimal terpene extraction. Lower heat preserves ginger's subtle spice. Session: 5-10 minutes as needed for stress management.
safety: Ginger: Well-tolerated; caution with blood thinners. Peppermint: Safe for most. Tulsi: Well-tolerated; may aid sleep and stress resilience. Not for pregnancy or nursing. Age 21+.

name: Breathe Easy
description: An entry-level stress relief blend featuring Peppermint and Mullein for smooth, refreshing vapor. Value-priced for those new to herbal vaping.
benefits: Peppermint provides cooling aromatics with alertness support
Mullein offers smooth, neutral base for comfortable vapor
Simple, clean profile ideal for beginners
Cost-effective introduction to herbal vaping
usage: Start at 150°C (302°F) for smooth vapor production. Mullein's neutral base accommodates wide temperature range. Session: 5-10 minutes as desired.
safety: Peppermint: Generally safe. Mullein: Well-tolerated respiratory herb with long history of use. Both safe for vaporization. Not for minors. FDA disclaimer applies.

name: Dream Weaver
description: A premium sleep support blend combining Valerian, Lavender, and Hops for profound relaxation and sleep enhancement. Honeyed aromatics with sedative botanicals.
benefits: Valerian in fixed combinations shows strong signals for sleep quality improvement
Lavender reduces stress and anxiety via limbic system modulation
Hops contributes sedative effects for sleep onset
Premium combination for those with persistent sleep difficulties
usage: Low-to-moderate temperatures (150-177°C / 302-350°F) preserve delicate volatiles. Increase to 190-204°C (374-400°F) for fuller extraction. Extended session (10-20 minutes) before bedtime.
safety: Valerian: Monitor sedation; may interact with CNS depressants. Lavender: Safe; mild sedation. Hops: Sedative effects. Avoid with alcohol or other sleep medications. Not for pregnancy/nursing.

name: Soothing Essence
description: A comprehensive anxiety relief blend combining Chamomile, Lavender, and Lemon Balm. Floral and citrus notes with multiple anxiolytic mechanisms.
benefits: Chamomile reduces anxiety through GABA modulation across multiple populations
Lavender inhalation significantly reduces anxiety in systematic review of 11 trials
Lemon Balm provides additional anxiolytic support with calming properties
Triple-action formula for comprehensive anxiety management
usage: Start at 150-177°C (302-350°F) to preserve floral aromatics. Gradually increase to 190-204°C (374-400°F) for balanced extraction. Session: 5-15 minutes as needed.
safety: Chamomile: Asteraceae allergy caution. Lavender: Safe for most. Lemon Balm: Generally safe; mild drowsiness possible. May enhance effects of other sedatives. Not for pregnancy.

name: Emotion Balance
description: A premium mood support blend featuring Damiana, Rose, Chamomile, and St. John's Wort for emotional balance and well-being. Complex sweet-herbal profile.
benefits: St. John's Wort shows efficacy comparable to SSRIs for mild-to-moderate depression in meta-analyses
Damiana provides traditional mood support with pleasant aromatics
Rose offers gentle mood-lifting properties
Chamomile supports overall emotional well-being and anxiety reduction
usage: Begin at 160°C (320°F) to preserve delicate aromatics. Increase to 190-204°C (374-400°F) as desired. Session: 10-15 minutes for mood support.
safety: St. John's Wort: HIGH interaction risk via CYP3A4 induction; avoid with many medications. Consult healthcare provider. Damiana: Safe in moderation. Rose: No contraindications. Chamomile: Allergy caution. Not for use with antidepressants without medical supervision.
